Subsection.Text: An industrial life insurance policy may not exclude or restrict the payment of the face amount by reason of the fact that the death of the insured occurred due to the act of another.

Each of the optional benefits and charges provided under an industrial life insurance policy must be separately priced. The prices must be set forth in the policy in a clear, conspicuous, and understandable manner.

This section does not limit the rights of any assignee of any industrial life insurance policy to enforce any assignment pursuant to its terms and does not prohibit an insurer from recognizing any such assignment pursuant to its terms.
